website_summaries.verdict: Being compared to the Adidas Copa Mundial, it seems that Nike made the right move when they created the heritage-inspired Nike Premier. Praises flowed for the soft goat and kangaroo leather upper from the majority of the cleat’s users. The ball touch is also excellent says some of its buyers. Perhaps the only hitch for the shoe is its sizing. A consensus from reviewers is that the shoe comes in a size small. So, it is suggested by most to go a half-size up to get the best possible fit.
pros: An expert reviewer shared that the Nike Premier soccer cleat provides an excellent stud penetration due to its stud configuration
A number of commenters praised the amount of comfort brought about by its goatskin leather upper
A significant number of reviews loved the classic look sported by this Nike soccer shoe
The pair is a tad lighter than the Adidas Copa Mundial which is its direct competitor
A soccer cleat critic expressed delight in the Nike Premier soccer cleats’ apparent quality
One player mentioned how the firm ground shoe brings an excellent ball touch
cons: While not necessarily heavy, the Nike Premier soccer cleat is not the lightest cleat in the market, weighing at 8.6 ounces
There have been mixed reviews regarding the cleat’s fit as some say that the pair is true to size, while others argue that one needs to go a half size up for a good fit

customer_reviews.title: Superb - great for comfort
customer_reviews.text: Not usually a fan of Nike football boots, I opted for the Premier as they were cheaper than my preferred Puma King boots. Probably the most comfortable sub-£100 boots I've ever owned, the insole moulded to my foot after two games, meaning long-term comfort. The tongue is soft so that it doesn't dig into the front of your shin/ankle and the inside of it means striking even a hard ball doesn't cause any discomfort. Playing on a 3G pitch, the sealed toe portion means that black beads haven't ruined the sole just yet - which hopefully means they'll last a long time. Can't fault them, and I'll likely buy another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Damien Wilde

customer_reviews.title: Classic look, and you forget about them when wearing them: The mark of a great boot
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big fan of these boots for football refereeing. I am typically a size 11 for running and normal shoes, but went size 12 this time around in these: Size 11 would be WAY too tight (as in 'ouch') and 11.5 was borderline and I ended up with black toes last season. Size 12 has been absolutely perfect and they fit like a glove with no comfort whatsoever, right from the beginning. In short, when I am wearing these, I forget I am wearing them and just get on with the game. That's the mark of a good boot! Plus, they have a great classic look.
customer_reviews.author: Tristan

customer_reviews.title: Glad i tried something new
customer_reviews.text: Extremely comfortable boots. I always always had copa mundials and world cups as a player and for 18 years I never strayed. However as I now officiate rather than play I was finding that they rubbed when I was a linesman. These boots really have improved things and I wouldn't swap back
customer_reviews.author: MR I J HAWKINS

customer_reviews.title: Comfy!
customer_reviews.text: Class boots. Classics. Really nice boots. Good quality leather. Old school boots but really protect your foot. Comfy as well as apposed to some of the new boots around.
customer_reviews.author: Dean W

customer_reviews.title: Not Happy
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband ready to start the new season. Had first game last night and they are coming away at the front. He's wore them twice. Not happy at all 😞
customer_reviews.author: Michelle H.

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable shoe !
customer_reviews.text: The shoe is the most comfortable one that i had in a long time. After spending hundreds of pounds on the new models i have finally found one that is comparably cheap and high quality. the leather is very soft and comfortable. I always wore size EU 44 in Adidas shoes and now i went for 44.5 in the Nike Premier and it fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best football boots for coaches
customer_reviews.text: Excellent if you are coaching, very comfortable and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: K Mylo

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Love them. With other boots there is usually a breaking in period with these they fitted like a glove straight away. Extremely comfortable compare to Adidas and I am very happy with my purchase. Got them for £70 so feel that is good value
customer_reviews.author: Paul O

customer_reviews.title: They haven't been worn and I would love to but the correct size and return these
customer_reviews.text: They were too small, unfortunately. Can I return them? They haven't been worn and I would love to but the correct size and return these? Nothing to do with the advertising of the product but Nike sizing is different than other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great boot, Awful Durability !
customer_reviews.text: Great boots, soft, comfortable and lightweight, probably best boots I've ever worn. Reason for only 3 stars is the fact that they have already ripped after less then a months use :/ so durability is an issue
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BOOTS!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these my 13 yr old son, he values these boots over all the other expensive fancy modern boots he owns. Superb proper leather old Skool football boot!!! Excellent price and delivers next day with amazon prime. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Mr H.

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: Usually a size 9 in football boots, but these caused severe blistering on the inner side and heel of both feet after 45 minutes, returning for refund
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hi the boots were perfect just a little too shall I will be returning ...
customer_reviews.text: Hi the boots were perfect just a little too shall I will be returning the package then purchasing a size up
customer_reviews.author: jack challinor

customer_reviews.title: Very happy referee!
customer_reviews.text: One very happy referee! No "breaking in" needed. Husband says they are the best & most comfortable pair of boots he's ever had! (And he's a real fuss pot with these things!!)
customer_reviews.author: Sarlou

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Really good product but suggest going half a size up for a god fit
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Nike Premier Fg, Men's Football Competition Shoes
product_meta.description: A classic looking boot, it appears to be nike's answer to adidas's copa. Staying away from crazy colors, this basic black and white shoe could have been built 30 years ago. Some say it would make your touch better. Soft and supple kangaroo leather vamp and goat leather quarter and heel provide superior ball touch and comfort. Anatomical last delivers glove-like fit. Molded pe sock liner amplifies the natural foot shape and creates low-profile cushioning. Engineered performance insole board with lightweight tpu plate provides transitional flex, comfort and traction across a variety of pitch conditions. Great performance boot with a timeless design offering a full leather upper for great ball touch and feel. For use on firm, hard and artificial ground.
